p: Unlike PCR and DNA microarray methods, NGS does not require prior knowledge of genomic sequences of the viral pathogens. It does not also require target specific PCR primers and oligonucleotide probes [ 126, 130]. However, the use of NGS in clinical laboratories is limited because of the following reasons: the turnaround time, the number of samples per run, cost of sequencers, and requirement of skills in bioinformatics [ 10, 128, 131].
